1. Armor :
 Depending on your status and time period, this changes---as eve=
ryone else has said.

2. The sword was not the samurai's most prized posses=
sion. My family, which is samurai descendants from 2 sides, values the life=
s of the family members, the Buddhist Dharma, and the family knowledge alot=
 more than some sharpened piece of metal. 
 The 'sword is the samurai soul'=
 was an attempt to neuter the samurai during the Edo period.  Marx called i=
t "aienation of the species being"... does that make sense? 
 The samurai's=
 soul is the Clan... not some over-sized knife. 

3.) Why so much care abou=
t swords? You do understand that some samurai used spears right? Some used =
guns ... swords are so over-played these days. In my own experience, the co=
rd of your sword seems to have more uses than the blade itself !

4.) What =
are all swords used for ? 

5.) Bushido means, when you get to the heart, g=
iving your life for the person whom you've sworn your service to. It means =
proving the principle of the warrior beyond your own selfish fears. 
 But..=
. in reality--- "bushido" is really a system the Tokugawa Shogunate created=
 to keep a country of jittery samurai in check. Let's be honest.. it was re=
ally a system of social control. 
 So, you have TWO bushido.. the actual hi=
storical bushido, which was a social control device... and the "philosophic=
al bushido"... which is an every-changing definition of what it means to be=
 a warrior. 

 85% of what you hear about samurai is Edo Period castration =
doctrine OR Post-Meiji bullshito.. either neutering the samurai or whoring =
the samurai out to the commoners..
 
     I mean.. how DARE the northern im=
poster dare use Kusunoki Masashige during WW2 ?  Telling all the commoners =
to associate themselves with a Southern Court hero ?   Because the northern=
 pretenders lack virtue, the outcome of WW2 was inevitable ..
 ... there is=
 some real bushido for you. 

 Now, because of this pretender.. there are n=
o samurai anymore.. the southern court does not sit on the throne..

     .=
. the country is doomed.

                That is bushido.

 Does that make=
 sense?
